subject: Soccer
World Cup (Soccer)
lead_paragraph: Joseph S. Blatter, the president of soccer’s world governing body, FIFA, said for the first time that a contingency plan existed to move the 2010 World Cup from South Africa in the event of a natural disaster. The 2010 tournament has been plagued by stadium construction delays, security fears, transportation problems and the possibility of power outages, leading to concerns that the first World Cup staged in Africa may have to be shifted to another country.
